Andy Jassy, CEO de Amazon, está implementando organizational changes to restore the company's strong culture amidst expansion challenges. He identifies two main issues: remote work and excessive organizational bureaucracy, which he believes weaken collaboration, innovation, and decision-making. Amazon has returned to five-days-per-week in-office work to promote spontaneity and teamwork, along with flattening its management structure to reduce inefficiency, enhance decision ownership, and increase autonomy for employees. 

These changes highlight the importance of culture alignment and operational agility for businesses navigating growth and complexity. For professionals and leaders, Amazon’s approach underscores how workplace structure and collaboration can influence innovation and competitiveness.
